channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: I.C.J. Tells Israel to Facilitate Aid to Gaza
item.description: The International Court of Justice said Israel must work with U.N. agencies, including UNRWA, the group for Palestinian refugees, which Israel has ban...

item.title: Three Offers in One Month: Paramount’s Secret Pursuit of Warner Bros. Discovery
item.description: A letter from Paramount’s chief executive, David Ellison, to Warner Bros.’ board of directors reveals weeks of talks between the two companies.

item.title: University of Virginia Makes Deal With White House to Halt Investigations
item.description: The Justice Department had been scrutinizing one of the nation’s premier public universities over accusations of civil rights violations.

item.title: Border Patrol Plans Immigration Crackdown in S.F. Bay Area

item.title: Tesla reports record sales, record storage—but profit slips as tax-credit rush pulls demand forward
item.description: Tesla posted all-time highs in vehicle deliveries and energy storage deployments in Q3, lifting revenue, but compressed automotive margins and a pull-...

item.title: As national debt accelerates to $38 trillion, watchdog warns it’s ‘no way for a great nation like America to run its finances’
item.description: In just a little over two months, the national debt swelled by $1 trillion. This is twice as fast as the rate of growth since 2000, Michael Peterson s...

item.title: Crypto lost 1,000 jobs to AI since ChatGPT launched—but gained them back from other sectors, says a16z report
item.description: The top Silicon Valley venture firm also highlighted crypto users’ interest in privacy in its annual state of crypto briefing.

item.title: Beyond Meat’s 250% stock pop was spurred by a Dubai-based real estate developer. Now the company is squarely in meme-stock territory
item.description: The rally came after years of Beyond losing steam.

item.title: Prince Harry, Richard Branson, Steve Bannon, and ‘AI godfathers’ call on AI labs to halt their pursuit of ‘superintelligence’—warning the technology could surpass human control
item.description: An open letter backed by AI pioneers, policymakers, and public figures urges tech companies to pause the race toward superintelligent AI, warning that...

item.title: Oil Prices Dropped 18%, Helping Drivers, but Squeezing the Industry
item.description: Oil prices have fallen sharply this year as the global supply has remained strong and demand has been slow to grow.

item.title: Iceland Says It Is No Longer Mosquito-Free
item.description: Iceland was one of the only mosquito-free places in the world, at least according to its records. Not anymore.

item.title: U.S. Strikes Boat in Pacific, Expanding Operation Against Drug Running Suspects

item.title: The Steep Cost of A.I.
item.description: Some countries are trying hard not to be left out of the race for artificial intelligence. But this choice comes with consequences.

item.title: Drug-Smuggling Submarines on Display at Latin American Naval Base
item.description: A display of confiscated vessels at a naval base in Ecuador offers a peek at why drug smuggling is so hard to stop.
